Mr. Sachs, I’m with the Navy Seal hostage rescue team -- we’re here to take you home. SACHS is clearly in shock, scared even of Garrison -- da torture make everyone seem predatory -- GUNFIRE and SHOUTS from the camp -- in a few seconds it w be too much for Garrison to fight.
Position is compromised. Sir -- Yet Garrison pulls out a SMARTPHONE and shows it to Sachs

Hey. Hey. Look at this. Your family is waiting for you. Back home. A beautiful, teary-eyed WIFE and six-year-old SON talk in the phone’s camera, their tinny voices just beyond earsho for us, but Sachs hears them. His eyes focus. He holds the phone, staring at them. We d catch a little bit from the recording:
Come home, Daddy!
(in Garrison’s comm) You need to move now, lieutenant! But Garrison puts a gentle hand on Sachs’ shoulder:
Let’s get you back there.

An OSPREY HELICOPTER hovers as Garrison emerges from the brush with the hostage. Sniper teams cover them as Garris clips in -- winch pulling them to safety. Off the rescued hostage’s relieved face -- CUT TO: The SON’s face. Watching as a C-17 CARGO PLANE touches do

The plane comes to a halt. Bay doors open... and Garrison team steps out. Families are waiting in the parking lot. Wives welcome their men back. Children run into their fathers’ arms. Sachs is reunited with his family. But there’s no one there to meet Garrison. He jokes with teammates, exchanging good-byes as he walks off alone. Suddenly a ‘66 Chevy pick-up SCREECHES to a stop -- driv side door WHIPS open as GINA GARRISON, 20s, jumps out -- tackles Garrison in her embrace. As they smile and smooch
You’re late.
You're early. You know that thing each couple has? That's theirs.
The Chevy RACES down the highway, water glistening on bot sides of the road... almost too beautiful to be real. Gin drives. Garrison listens to the engine, watches her.
When you gonna let me buy you a truck born in this century?
When this beauty finally dies on me. Until then, I’m a loyal girl.
At least let me drive us to TJ.
(sarcastic) Because it’s so much like Florence.
(playing along) Florence has the Duomo, TJ has the donkey show.
We had our honeymoon in Mexico... so, it’s not that bad.
But it’s not your dream. We'll have a big getaway soon... I promise.
Not with your job, no sir.
I‘1l make time for it. Once you get pregnant --
You ready to be the stay-at-home dad? She grins at him, playful. Garrison grins back.
I’‘1l have to retire early, then. Or is that your whole plan?

I’m a proud supporter of any plan that keeps you close to home. Until then, lieutenant, we'll just have to practice making babies -- a lot. He kisses her on the neck as they ROAR towards the border She's trying to keep one eye on the road, but damn does h a good job of distracting her.

Day of the Dead celebration is in full effect. Brightly colored paper maché skeletons. Coffins over-flowing with carnations. Children in skull face paint. A FIRE-BREATHER shoots a stream of flames into the night
The orange fire-light glows outside the window to this ho room, where Gina turns down the sheets. Drifting into the --
Garrison stands in front of the mirror, shirtless. His ch is a roadmap of old scars. He’s inspecting a potential ne one; some scrape he got in Colombia. Gina enters, snakes her arms around him.
You okay?
Yeah, just grazed my pride is all. Maybe I’m losing my touch.
Oh, you got plenty of moves, husband. She grapples him around the waist and neck.
Show me how you get out of this one. Garrison smiles -- this is their foreplay.
Well, you step into their space --
Oh I like that -- He plants a foot between hers, puts his hands on her arms

Then you just twist, and -- In a slow spin, he’s twirled her around and grappled her similar fashion. Gina distracts him with a kiss, and as he starts to get l in that sensuality -- She tips him off-balance and then yanks him out of the bathroom door, tossing him onto --
-- where she descends on him, only to be partially pinned Garrison pulls at her cotton top.
The celebration is louder now; more crowded and full of music. There’s something chaotic and intense about the en in the streets. A manic parade.
Just as intense, but full of a different energy -- passio Ray and Gina make love. Their skin glistens with sweat... they’re not done. Not yet. The festival builds as their bodies collide until --
The pre-dawn light shines through the window. The street below is quiet. They lie in each others arms... somewhere between awake and dreaming.
Who do you think our kid would look like?
She better look like you. ‘Cause me in a dress ain’t pretty.
She?
It's less surprising that I’ve worn a dress than I said “she?”
You do like to work undercover... Garrison pulls the sheets up as Gina giggles.
I do my best work under cover...
I’m serious --
I don’t know... just always assumed I'd have a little girl. Teach her to play guitar... to stand up for herself... walk her down the aisle... Gina traces her fingers over his Navy Seal tattoo.
I feel sorry for the boy who shows up for that first date...
If he shows up, he’ll be the bravest kid in school.
Or the dumbest. (hopeful) If you really want to be a father... Garrison is torn, but the truth comes out:
I got a few more years of the work in me. Gina’s smile fades.
I know. I’m not pushing you.
I just can’t be both. Meaning both a SEAL and a father.
Yeah... (then) Besides, I think I love tequila too much to quit anytime soon. They cuddle close again, but now they both stare off in different directions, each preoccupied with a what-if...
The remnants of the festival litter the street. Scattered paper maché skulls stare back... smiling faces of death.
Garrison WAKES with a start. He rolls over to find... nothing. No one. Gina’s gone.

Gina...? No response. He gets up. Searches the room... until he fi a note, scrawled on the back of a receipt. Went to get us breakfast, back soon. Practice makes perfe Garrison breathes a sigh of relief. Sits for a moment. Lo in his own thoughts... GARRISON (V.O., PRE-LAP) (CONT’D) Sorry to call so early. Just needed to talk...
Garrison’s on the balcony, leaving a voicemail.
Thinking about getting out of the field, taking that instructor’s post. Anyway... give me a shout.
Garrison’s in the shower, hears Gina return.  10.

You’re late! (beat) Hey -- I said, “You’re late!” Garrison peeks out of the shower curtain -- GARRISON (CONT’D) “You're early?” He spots someone in the mirror-- and it ain’t Gina. Two men in street clothes clear the room like PROS. Move the bathroom, aim M7 Trang pistols at the shower -- DARTS perforate the curtain. Then -- nothing. PRO ONE covers Pro Two as he steps into the bathroom... shower BLASTING... reaches out... WHIPS the curtain back finds -- nothing. Huh? Suddenly he’s PUNCHED in the junk by Garrison, huddled on floor of the tub taking cover. Pro Two crumbles -- Garrison GRABS his shirt -- SLAMS his face into the tub -- HARD. Pro One fires -- Garrison uses Two's body as a shield -- takes his weapon and returns. They empty their clips. Pro One reloads -- Garrison doesn hesitate -- RIPS down the shower curtain and CHARGES -- Garrison attacks -- soaking wet and completely naked. Lightning-fast, hand-to-hand. Garrison uses the shower curtain to deflect blows and disorient -- Pro One LUNGES at Garrison -- who quickly sidesteps so th Pro One inadvertently CRASHES through the window and onto balcony, buying Garrison enough time to SPRINT into the -
Where he accidentally SLAMS into a stunned AUSSIE tourist more than a little shocked by the butt-naked Garrison.
Think you forgot a few things, friend. The aussie tourist tries to help Garrison to his feet -- then STABS Garrison with an auto injector.
A shocked Garrison tries to run... but his legs lock-up.. his vision... cloudy... finally he collapses as we -- CUT  11.
Then... Led Zeppelin, Stairway to Heaven. Guitar RIPPING. Blackness becomes blinding white light as a hood comes of
Garrison opens his eyes... can’t adjust to the glare. The music. It’s overwhelming.
Back from the dead. Garrison tries to get his bearings... in some kind of:
Can’t see much... interrogation light is intense... music grating. In front of him is that aussie tourist.
Zeppelin, absolute genius.
Who...
Led Zeppelin. Jimmy Page, Robert --

I’m the guy who ruined your vacation. Garrison’s color is coming back -- confidence returning.
Well, I’m the guy who makes less than a public school teacher, so if you’re looking for a ransom --
Oh, I don’t need money.
Then... what?
Information. About your missions in Colombia? Shit. This isn’t just some Mexican ransom play...  12.
See, friend, I make a very good living selling weapons to the FARC guerrillas. But when there’s instability in the FARC, there’s instability in my business.
Well, your business ain’t getting any more stable, ‘cause all you’re getting out of me is name, rank, and a hearty helping of go- fuck-yourself.
Oh, but we’re serving something much tastier tonight... Aussie gives the cue and his GUYS drag in Gina. Bound and gagged, she’s scared out of her mind. Garrison goes white
Those brass balls just got a whole lot softer.
I’m about to tell you the God’s honest truth: I’m a professional, like you. All I care about is getting the job done and going home. I don’t know where the intel comes from and I don’t care.
Bet you care now? Aussie RIPS the tape off Gina’s mouth, sticks his .45 in.
That’s it, Flower, take it all... He PUSHES the barrel deep into her throat. Gina GAGS -- h face, pure terror. Garrison tries to get Aussie’s attenti

Look at me -- LOOK AT ME. Aussie does. Something about Garrison's voice -- like thi the most important moment of his life. GARRISON (CONT’D) If I knew, I’d tell you. Ask me anything else, anything you want to know. But this I can’t tell you. Because I don’t know. Aussie and Garrison hold each other’s gaze... Finally --  13.
I believe you. He takes his gun out of Gina’s mouth. She GASPS... tears streaming down her face.
It’s gonna be okay, baby -- I promise. She smiles -- believes him -- loves him with all her hear Aussie casually turns off the music.

Well, this has been a colossal waste of time. And SHOOTS Gina in the head. The world slows down... the blast knocking Gina over in h chair... Garrison watches as her eyes go cold... dead bef she even hits the ground. Suddenly time SNAPS back and -- Garrison explodes -- snot and spit -- doesn’t give a fuck

Garrison's corpse. In a black abyss. A red light begins to BLINK... illuminating the rest of Garrison’s dead body. Nothing more than a husk, a vessel vengeance and violence. Commence bioelectrical charge. That’s when we hear it... a beat... building in our ears.
Fifty percent... Soon the beat becomes a song... a song we recognize...
Seventy-five percent... “Stairway to Heaven” by Led Zeppelin. What the hell?
Full cycle. An electrical charge RIPS through Bloodshot’s corpse -- h body SPASMS -- and then stops... lying there motionless.. until his eyes flutter open. He’s alive.
Subject is conscious. BP one forty over ninety. Heart Rate seventy-five. Brain function normal. Bloodshot tries to move, but can’t -- limbs locked in pla

Language centers online.

(in English) Identify yourself. Bloodshot is beyond confused. What the hell is going on?  15.

I don’t know... Bloodshot thrashes violently, emotions overwhelming him.
Initiate sedation.
WHY DON’T I KNOW?!?
The music kicks in again. Skipping like a record as it dr that grating vocal into our brains. As we wind on down the -- As we wind on down the As we wind on down the --
Bloodshot wakes with a start. Looks around. He’s in a:

Sterile. White. Looks like your average hospital room. Th music has stopped. Bloodshot sits up. He’s wearing a hospital gown -- nothin else. His skin is pale. His head -- pounding. Seems to be fine except... his sternum aches. Pulls the gown off his shoulders revealing... A circular red scar in the middle of his white chest.
The door opens and in walks DR. EMIL HARTING, 40s. Built a rugby player, the first thing we notices is that there’ something odd about his arm... robotic.
(British accent) How are you feeling? Bloodshot rubs his temples...
Hell of a hangover.  16.
Then you remember -- what a hangover feels like? Harting’s trying to act normal but he’s clearly on edge.
Unfortunately, yes.
That’s good.
Says you. Speaking of --
Dr. Emil Harting, Rising Spirit Technologies.
(re: his lack of memory) I'd return the courtesy but I’ve got this little problem...

Unfortunately I’m not going to be much help. This is what we have on you. Harting retrieves a SLIM FILE for Bloodshot, who looks in to find a brief PROFILE of who he once was: Lieutenant Raymond Garrison, U.S. Navy SEAL. The page is labeled TOP SECRET, and the bit at the bottom is why: “Cadaver sold to Rising Spirit Technologies.”
Your remains were sold to us by the US military. All personnel records, destroyed.
(in total shock) My... remains?
We brought you back. That’s when Harting smiles, barely containing his excitem

We've been experimenting with nanites -- robotic proteins. They can rebuild otherwise healthy tissues on a cellular level after catastrophic injury.  17. Harting touches the wall... it becomes a view screen. ON THE MONITOR: Images of those alien machines from the opening... working furiously.

We had so much success with individual organ systems that we decided to try a full transfusion. Your blood was replaced with the nanites... and they repaired everything. Even your oxygen-starved brain. Harting looks almost as shocked as Garrison.
I’m... an experiment?
Based on animal trials we expected -- optimum outcome -- that you’d be in a vegetative state. But here you are.
My memories, they’re gone...
Our best guess? The nanites revitalized the brain tissues but couldn’t recreate past experiences. To put it simply, we saved the hard drive but lost the data.
But I remember how to walk. How to talk. I know that seven times seven is forty nine and that the capital of New York is Albany.

You also know the square root of seven thousand nine hundred and twenty one... ENDOSCOPIC SHOT: Bloodshot’s brain -- a nanite builds a synapse -- FLASH ON: thousands of numbers, speeding by -- land on --
Eighty nine.
The word for father in, I don’t know, Swahili. ENDOSCOPIC SHOT: Bloodshot’s brain -- nanites create anot synapse --  18. FLASH ON: Swahili translations for, “Fate,” “Fateful,” th
Father... “Abu.”
And the winner of the Tour de France in, say, 1909 --
Francois Faber. How do I know that?
There are billions of web-enabled microprocessors inside your brain. Any information they don’t already know, they can pull that data from the ‘net.
Can they tell me who I am? Figure out what happened to me?
Let me show you something... Harting takes off his lab coat, revealing a gleaming prosthetic arm connected to his twitching shoulder muscle

As a kid, I was a tennis prodigy. Good but not great -- no serve. On my fifteenth birthday I got Cancer. Six months later they took my arm. Instead of focusing on what I had lost, I focused on what I had been given... an opportunity to do something else with my life. PhD from MIT by twenty-two, my first military contract by twenty-four, and my own firm -- Rising Spirit Technologies -- by thirty. One day soon, when a soldier loses his arm... Harting raises his cybernetic fist and SLAMS it into the metal table -- leaving a massive dent.
..-he’s going to get a better one. Because I forgot who I was and focused on who I could become.
(catching on) Rising Spirit... bet you got a hell of a serve now?  19. Harting smiles. Clearly these two are going to become brothers... both given a second chance by technology.
Let’s see what you can do now.

State of the art testing center. Bloodshot is caged in a giant water wheel: the human equivalent of a hamster whee except this one is dipped in a pool, requiring Bloodshot strain his muscles to power the mill wheel. Setup nearby: EKG, mobile CT, and a pulse ox monitor.
Eight miles per hour, at a water resistance of seventy-five pounds. Harting and a handful of TECHS watch as Bloodshot STRAINS and moves the giant wheel under his own power.

Push him to ten. ENDOSCOPIC SHOT: Bloodshot’s lungs -- nanites work to EXP his alveoli so that -- Bloodshot BREATHES deeper -- his lungs working more efficiently, allowing him to -- Crest past ten MPH on the monitor. All the while the pool CHURNS from the turning of the wheel. Fighting Bloodshot every step.
But I had a life...

Bloodshot follows Harting on a tour of the facility. Hart is now dressed in a custom lab coat -- the lack of collar colorful trim make it seem vaguely Asian. Bloodshot looks down at the Navy Seal tattoo on his arm.. BLOODSHOT (CONT’D) ...there must’ve been people I loved... I cared about.
They said their good-byes. You need to do the same. We’re on a new frontier here...  20. They pass above an indoor track. Techs observe a VET jogg on hydrogen powered prosthetic legs...

There are no guarantees with this process... tomorrow you could be gone. For good. Do you really want to risk putting them through that again? The vet begins to SPRINT -- faster than Usain Bolt. Blood can hardly believe his eyes...
What is this place?
Hope. For every warrior wounded on a battlefield. And for soldiers like you.
- A TEST PILOT in a hydraulic skeleton LIFTS steel plates

In this facility alone, we’re developing everything from exoskeletons that can help aman lift ten-times his weight... - A PATIENT with a prosthetic leg re-learns how to swim i Olympic-sized POOL with help from a TRAINER.
...to smart prosthetic limbs so the critically injured can live normal lives... - A RESEARCH SCIENTIST presents a paper on cybernetic eye
..-even ocular implants that will allow the blind to see.
Harting and Bloodshot finish their tour on the top floor Rising Spirit’s skyscraper. The Hong Kong skyline glimmer around them... it's breath-taking -- and entirely man-mad
We're on the precipice of a paradigm shift... and you’re the proof.
But am I really alive? It’s been, what, twenty-four hours...  21.

Bloodshot has his arm under a scanning electron microscop BLOODSHOT (CONT’D) --.and I’m not the least bit tired. Harting looks through the eye-piece at Bloodshot’s skin cells. The monitor behind him displays the image.
From the day we stop growing, our bodies begin dying. Our skin cells wither away, our muscles are cannibalized, and our bones degrade. Harting reaches for a scalpel...
But not you. The nanites are constantly repairing your body on a cellular level.
So I'll never have to exfoliate again?

It’s a little more exciting than that... FLASH of the scalpel -- Harting SLICES Bloodshot’s hand - recoils -- but Harting pins his wrist under the microscop ON THE SCREEN: The magnified nanites pour out of the woun and stitch the skin back together... one cell at a time. Holy shit. Harting releases him. Bloodshot stares at his as the cut disappears before our eyes.
Yeah. That’s exciting.
New, day -- same water wheel. Display reads: 20 mph... 21 Bloodshot is soaked in sweat, right at the point of break
Okay. That’s enough.
The record at this resistance level is twenty-five miles per hour... ENDOSCOPIC SHOT: Bloodshot’s quads -- with each stride, muscles tear -- but are instantly repaired by the nanites  22.

An Bloodshot nearly rolls the thing out the pool. He hits against the inside and spins like a stray piece of clothi in an enormous dryer, and then... Collapses.
The turbine -- it cracked. Bloodshot can’t help but smile. He broke the thing.
Better get a new one.
Thanks for the advice. Bloodshot’s head snaps up --
What did you say?
Thanks for the advice. (beat) Why? Bloodshot’s heart rate picks up... POUNDING in our ears..
Nothing. Harting holds his gaze... something's definitely wrong. Bloodshot grabs a water. That’s when we hear it... music. BLOODSHOT (CONT’D) You hear that?
Hear what? It's Stairway to Heaven. Bloodshot sits -- head in his ha Music won’t stop -- like a hammer, SLAMMING into his brai A TEST PILOT enters --  23.

head_text.subj: I NEED TO FIND THAT AUSSIE BASTARD.

text: How do you know he’s Australian?

He just shot her... FLICKER THROUGH dozens of images: the mission in Colombia Day of the Dead festival in Mexico, Aussie smiling as he his .45 down Gina’s throat... Bloodshot remembers everything we’ve seen so far.

I can see his face -- like it just happened. But that’s it -- nothing else. Not my name, not his, nothing... only her... my wife, Gina.  28. Last image is of Gina in the Chevy as they race toward th border, sun flaring off the water... it’s so beautiful it breaks your heart. BACK TO:
Why do I remember those two days and nothing else? Not my parents -- not my childhood -- not even my own name.
Honestly... I don’t know. Maybe because those last few days were so significant that they’re seared into your mind? Like muscle memory.
I have to find him... have to make him pay for Gina. She’s the one thing I know I loved in this world, and that one thing is gone. All that’s left is... anger.
Listen to me, you need time here to train. And I need time to study you. Bloodshot is torn... drowning in guilt.
Have you ever lost someone that meant everything to you? Harting opens up to Bloodshot, looking him in the eye.
More than once. Every time, I thought I’d never recover. Never get attached again. (breath) That’s the triumph of the human spirit, I guess. You get up and try again.
I can’t do that until he’s dead.

You are a prototype. One of a kind. In the world of science, that’s useless. We need to find a way to reproduce your results if we're going to save lives. This isn’t about you. It’s about soldiers who could return home to their loved ones... Bloodshot considers Harting’s words...  29.
Do this for me, and I’1l use every resource at my disposal to help you find this man.
And end him.
You have my word. Harting touches the control screen. Restraints retract and Bloodshot falls to his knees. As Harting helps him to his feet...
One more thing: after I kill him... he stays dead. Bloodshot walks past, for the door, and --
A helicopter ROARS out of the city...
Harting’s at the helm, Bloodshot sitting next to him.
Every human has deep-rooted survival instincts. You have to unlearn them.
Unlearn --? They’re called ‘survival instincts’ for a good reason, Doc.

They don’t apply to you now. The goal posts have moved. The nanites in your body can do more than simply heal a wound. They are tools to let you adapt. Modify. Overcome. You simply command them to do your bidding.
Will this be painful? Sounds painful --
(interrupting) My field test team “Chainsaw” is going to put you in the most stressful situations possible -- push you until you learn to change your body in response.  30.
“Chainsaw?”
Cut down every prototype I throw at them. Harting smiles as the helicopter SOARS over the mountains revealing --
Our field test center. The Shed. A dozen high-tech buildings nestled into the unforgiving mountainside...
As Bloodshot and Harting enter from the helipad, they’re by the three members of CHAINSAW: mortally wounded soldie improved by Rising Spirit tech. Just like Bloodshot.

Lieutenant Marcus Tibbs is our team leader, counter intelligence expert, and sniper. LT. MARCUS TIBBS (African-American, 30s) has a kind face covered in scars. Cybernetic eyes mark him as the sniper stopped Bloodshot’s escape.
Sorry ‘bout that head shot.
Just glad you missed my face.
Wasn’t aiming for your face. Off Tibbs’s intimidating look, FLASH TO:
Tibbs’s cybernetic eye looks through his rifle’s scope -- he sees is vegetation. Jungle sounds fade... replaced by ROAR of a JEEP.

A mortar explosion left Tibbs blind and deaf. With cochlear implants for hearing and ocular prosthetics for eyes... Tibbs’s eyes SNAP red -- revealing the DRIVER’S heat signature. He fires... the heat signature goes dark. BACK  31.
Tibbs never misses.
Don’t have to see you to kill you.
Wish I didn’t have to see Tibbs. Got a face like my nut sack. Out of his exoskeleton, So Long stands on next-gen prosth legs, partially obscured by his cargo shorts.
You already met Corporal Harlin “So Long” Shifflet.
So Long?
What we say to the bad guys when ass-bag here takes the field.
Ladies called me “So Long” way before I met this crew.
After an IED took So Long’s legs, we built him a new pair... Off So Long’s “go-fuck-yourself” grin, FLASH TO:
So Long stomps through rubble in his exoskeleton.

Exoskeleton means there isn’t a cannon he can’t wield, making him our go-to for heavy artillery and urban assault. So Long fires his sound cannon. Iraqi GUNMEN flee, every orifice bleeding. BACK TO: So Long rubs his swollen jaw where Bloodshot nailed him w the stun baton during his failed escape...
Still owe ya for that cheap shot, Snow White.  32.
Know what’s intimidating? Your knowledge of Disney princesses. Before So Long can respond, a striking Indian woman with sleek air filters mounted on a neck brace intercedes.

Don’t mind So Long -- his assertions of male dominance are just attempts to compensate for phallic deficiency. Harting nods towards the woman... she’s the one who threw sarin gas grenade during Bloodshot’s failed escape.
Warrant Officer Kareena “KP” Pillai is an expert in chemical weapons and psychological warfare. Off KP’s enigmatic gaze, FLASH TO:
KP enters a crack house with just a thermos. TWEAKERS see defenceless beauty and move in for the kill...

Her trachea was severed by a stray bullet in Afghanistan so now she breathes through a clavicle mounted respirator. KP opens the thermos -- gas escapes -- bad guys foam at t mouth and spontaneously shit their shorts. BACK TO:
As a result she’s immune to inhalants.
Only thing more dangerous than KP’s knowledge of biological weapons is her lack of social grace.
After you suffer a neck injury it’s hard to suffer fools. So Long glares at Bloodshot... doesn’t like the idea of b upstaged by Harting’s latest break-through.
So what do we call the noob... “B.S."? He looks to his teammates for a laugh -- doesn't get one.  33.
Did I say fools? I meant, “fool.” Bloodshot takes in the Chainsaw crew... his new “family.”
Wounded warriors. I get it.
No longer wounded. Enhanced. Improved. And most of all, given purpose. This is why they’re here. Same with you.
Welcome to the freak show.

Bloodshot faces off against Harting, on opposite ends of outdoor dojo. Chest-high metal rods like half-built columns punctuate t space between Bloodshot and Harting in a spread-out grid. Harting draws a SAMURAI SWORD from its scabbard, wielding with his prosthetic arm.
For this exercise, you must disarm me.
You made a pun there.
Take the sword from my hand. Harting gets into a defensive stance. Watchful.
One question, doc. Will any of this training help get my memory back?
Your memory? I don’t know. It’s possible. With enough stimulation, the nanites --

(I got my answer) Whatever, let’s do this. Bloodshot advances, quick on his feet... For a few moments the two dance, lunging and dodging...  34. But then Harting strikes, snake-swift, the blade SLICING Bloodshot in the leg. BLOODSHOT (CONT’D) Shit! Hang on, time out, I’m -- Harting stabs him AGAIN. Bloodshot falls over in mortal pain.
A windowless room with tumbling mats for a floor. Under fluorescent light, Bloodshot and KP square off. She a sleek metal QUARTER-STAFF but Bloodshot is empty-handed
So what are we doing now? Harting’s voice booms from the intercom overhead. And Bloodshot finds him watching from a plate glass window.
Try to reach the door behind KP. KP winks at Bloodshot.

That one right there? KP pulls down a set of high-tech GOGGLES and then -- The lights go OUT. And it is crazy dark now. BLOODSHOT (CONT’D) Waitaminute -- But we can hear the WHOOSH-WHOOSH of the quarter-staff in motion and barely make out the silhouette of KP advancing KP’S POV In a green-ish world, she attacks Bloodshot, who’s trying get his bearings but then she sweeps his legs from under and he goes down HARD on the mat --
Shit!
A hooded and bound Bloodshot rides next to Tibbs as they between the mountains.  35.
World record is twenty-two minutes, believe it or not. That’s crazy, isn’t it? So you gotta make half an hour.
Half an hour doing what? Tibbs then PUSHES him out of the helicopter. Bloodshot FALLS thirty feet to certain death -- SLAMMING against the surface of a --
Holding your breath! Hands bound, Bloodshot begins to sink... panic setting in

Take control of your body -- adapt. Bloodshot flexes -- breaks the plastic cuffs -- swims for surface just as -- Tibbs spots him with his sniper rifle from the helicopter opens fire. Bloodshot panics -- can’t break the surface without taking a head shot.
What if this kills me?
The nanites will signal us if you lose consciousness. We can revive you.
So Long stands at a charcoal grill where he’s heated up several rocks until they glow. Bloodshot stands opposite him, uneasy.
You’re gonna hold one of these in your hand until you can count to twenty. So Long pulls out a scalding hot rock with a pair of tong
But that thing’s -- Hold out your hand.  36. Bloodshot reluctantly does so. So Long drops the stone in his hand -- and Bloodshot immediately DROPS the thing --
Shit! So Long turns around to smirk at a watchful HARTING from elevated observation deck.
I woulda done it on the first try.
Bloodshot falls hard, clutching his leg. Instead of blood, a black fluid like tar, full of nanites spreads quickly.
I nicked the femoral artery. Close the wound quickly. Focus. A normal man would die from this in twenty seconds. Bloodshot is breathing hard, panicking.
I’m gonna die --
You don’t have to.
Oh my god you're a terrible doctor. His eyes start to roll up into his head, and the red circ on his chest begins to GLOW a warning, and --
Bloodshot wakes up suddenly and reaches for his leg, to f he’s in a hospital room, hooked up to high-tech EKG gear. Harting stands at the door, arms crossed.
Try again.
Back to the KP test in darkness. She’s still whooping his before he can take two steps in any direction.  37.
I can’t see a thing!

Then fix it so you can. Breathing hard, staying low, Bloodshot blinks -- ENDOSCOPIC SHOT: Inside his eye, just behind the lens, ro and cones reorganizing until the eye becomes more CAT-LIK and then -- BLOODSHOT’S POV Now he can see her. And the door. Everything has more of desaturated feel; grainy. But visible. BLOODSHOT MOVES -- and KP attacks -- but this time he’s r for her, parrying and dodging --

It’s working! And then a new overlay appears as Bloodshot fights KP: A tech TARGETING RETICULE, tracing KP’s movement, analyzing BLOODSHOT (CONT’D) This tech even has combat analytics. Bam! He gets a good counterattack on KP, turning the tide...
Don’t hate me for this. So KP then throws a chemical at his face and BLINDS HIM.
Oh COME ON! KP then attacks him again -- and Bloodshot falls HARD to floor with a THUD, arms splayed out --
Bloodshot sits up, waking suddenly, with the electrodes o his chest as his circular scar FADES. He gasps for air.
Bloodshot’s below the surface... he exhales... focusing. But then he starts to panic, old survival instincts screa that he can’t be doing what he’s doing, and GLUB-GLUB --  38.
Bloodshot sits up, waking suddenly, in a coughing fit.
Bloodshot’s clenched hand trembles as smoke curls up from molten ROCK he’s holding, hissing through his teeth:

Nineteen... twenty! He drops the thing right away and stares at his hand -- The badly burned flesh instantly REPAIRS, softly shushing sizzling flesh until he’s back to normal. Bloodshot look up, triumphant, until he sees So Long comi at him with something new -- A blowtorch.
Bloodshot wakes again, with the same EKG electrodes on hi chest. He checks his skin for burns. Just pale flesh inst
The lights clack back on, but the chemical toxins KP thre Bloodshot still have him blinded. KP attacks, demanding:

Adapt again! Come on! Bloodshot strains his ears again -- ENDOSCOPIC SHOT: Inside the eardrum, the space begins to reform, allowing him to hear every minute sound -- KP’S STAFF comes sailing down to strike him in the head b then Bloodshot CATCHES the blow with his palms and in two swift twists he DISARMS her of the weapon. Standing triumphant, Bloodshot raises his arms.

Adapted! I don’t need eyes to know I look good right now.  39. KP can’t help but grin at Bloodshot’s sudden snark, especially when she pulls a swift KICK TO HIS NUTS -- Bloodshot immediately collapses in a heap on the floor, wheezing in pain.
You still have weak spots. Remember that. Trick isn’t that you’re invincible. It’s that you can get back up. KP crouches down by Bloodshot, listening to him breathe through his teeth.
It’s just pain.
Easy for you to say --
Control the blood flow, the muscle group around that whole area. Trust me, I’m doing you a favor. Bloodshot starts to get up again but not before looking bewildered at KP:
How?
Later on you’1ll realize this level of control has... other uses. She means sex, Bloodshot.

Bloodshot now has to deal with SPINNING BLADES that pop o of the grid of metal poles. As he moves for Harting, he’s SLICED across one bicep. He grunts, grits his teeth... and the wound SEALS UP. Two more spinning blades CUT into him as he weaves for Harting, and both times he breathes through his mouth and cuts self-repair. Then Harting STRIKES, but Bloodshot DODGES, and Harting’s is so strong, the sword cuts right through a metal rod. B One less spinning blade for Bloodshot to worry about. Harting strikes again, an overhead blow this time --  40. Bloodshot CLAPS his hands together, CATCHING the blade -- But not quite as elegantly as he’d like. Black blood drip down his arm. Grabbing the blade with both hands, his palms getting bad sliced, he wrenches the sword from Harting. It clatters to the floor.
Congrats. What you’ve become, what we've done this last week... it’s remarkable. Bloodshot clasps hands with Harting, congratulating... an then Harting plunges a SEPPUKU KNIFE into Bloodshot’s gut
Sonofabitch, doc-- Bloodshot is suddenly on his knees. In shock at seeing th hilt sticking out of his abdomen.

The ancient samurai were mentally prepared for death. Trained for it. Your training must surpass that. I have given you a mortal wound. If you get one out there in the world, and you don’t heal yourself, then it’s lights out. Because we won’t be there to revive you. Bloodshot grimaces. Bleeding out on the rocks. He notices skin starts to turn GRAY as it does. And then, through his shirt -- a brief PULSE OF RED LIGHT the shape of a circle. Exactly where his chest scar is.
What... was that...

An alert system hardwired into the nanites, when you’re starting to lose too much of them. When you’re about to die. Unless you do something, right now. Your body has the power but your mind has doubt. Leap of faith time. Step off that ledge.
I... can’t... FLASH ON: Aussie... smiling. That smug bastard. Is this a sign Bloodshot is getting some memory back? BACK TO:  41.

Then I’m sorry. For both of us. If you can’t do this, I'd rather you die here, at Rising Spirit, than out there, losing any chance I might have to study your remains. Bloodshot pulls out the sword and lets it clatter on the rocks beneath him.

Two... things... Bloodshot contorts in pain -- then rises to his knees. BLOODSHOT (CONT’D) First... that hurt. A lot. He slowly stands... the gut-wound closing before our eyes BLOODSHOT (CONT’D) Second... we made a deal. I survive your stress tests, you help me keep my promise: find that Aussie prick and end him. Harting can’t help but smile.

Bloodshot stares intently. Rubbing his chin. REVERSE to reveal the object of his attention: A fully- stocked VENDING MACHINE. Chips, snacks, candy, energy dri Bloodshot puts in a full twenty dollars. And starts press buttons. KP enters, carrying something under one arm. A box.
Hey.
Hey yourself.
Just wanted to check in, see how you are. Bloodshot pulls a bag of nacho cheese tortilla chips from vending machine. Opens it. Tries one. As he does:

Well, I lived through Harting’s whole samurai speech, so I got that going for me.  42. Bloodshot shrugs at the nacho cheese chip. Sets the bag a and presses another button. This time it’s peanut butter crackers. He tries one.
Yeah, he can be melodramatic. But it’s because he’s a man of principle and-- what are you doing? Bloodshot is now sampling cookies. He likes these.
Figuring out what I like. These -- (holds up chips) -- are an abomination. But these -- (holds up cookies) -- I could eat a hundred, right now.
You want to, but when you do, you immediately regret it. Trust me. (then) You really don’t remember anything? Bloodshot gets a far-off look in his eye, smiling sadly.

I remember Gina... She’s the only mirror I have to my life. You know? I don’t know the things I did, but I know her smile. (beat) So either she was way out of my league and I got lucky, or I was a goddamn saint.

Well. I ever find a guy, and his memory gets wiped but he still remembers me, I'd say I’m the lucky one. It’s a loaded moment... a bond forming between these two. Mutual respect, maybe a little envy from KP. That’s when she offers him the box tucked under her arm.
What is this?

The Navy shipped you out with your personal effects, I guess to make it cleaner for them. Maybe... maybe something will jog your memory. Just don’t tell anyone I gave this to you.  43. Bloodshot takes the box like it’s the Crown Jewels. INT. BLOODSHOT’S BUNK ROOM - MOMENTS LATER Bloodshot stares at the box, then opens it. Inside: A broken wrist watch. A wallet that’s been gutted except for a few discount cards, and... An iPod. Bloodshot tries to power it up -- it’s dead. But he finds a charger under a shirt.
The device boots up and he can access it. The first app t jumps out at him is “Music.” Already queued on the playlist is some classic Def Leppar The cow bell sounds tinny on the little speaker.

“It’s better to burn out, than to fade away.” How could I ever forget you guys? He pauses the music and closes the app. That’s when he sees the Photos feature. Clicks on it. In the Camera Roll: PHOTOS OF GINA. Candid moments of her dressed for a night out wit him -- posed as if she’s asking, “How do I look?” He thumbs through the pics, none of them really featuring much in the way of scenery beyond Gina on vacation with h Then one image, Gina running her hand through her hair --
Suddenly Bloodshot is in that very moment, right then, watching Gina run her hand through her hair, smiling coyl

Bloodshot trembles at the vivid moment. He nearly looks around the room as if he can suddenly smell her perfume.. But he is all alone. And his shoulders slump. His HAND grips the bunk, and he starts to WARP THE METAL a sorrow coming out as rage. But the groan of metal turns
THE ROAR of a helicopter on arrival to Rising Spirit.
INDIVIDUAL FACES flickering by -- thirty per second --
Encrypted hard-line access to the CIA/Interpol shared database.
Bloodshot watches the headshots on a view screen, Tibbs a Harting behind him.
Every driver's licence, passport, and mugshot ever taken. Three billion some-odd folks...
Facebook for feds. Thousands of images reflect off Bloodshot’s dark eyes.
If that Aussie is the needle, this is your haystack.
I’m running a diagnostic on your nanites’ bioelectrical system, so you may experience some weird lapses... Bloodshot doesn’t respond. Tibbs SNAPS his fingers in fro of Bloodshot: doesn’t even blink.
He’s already gone. BLOODSHOT’S POV: Time slows to a crawl, each face holding screen for a beat. Bloodshot takes it all in. Waiting for a FLASH OF:
Thanks for the advice.

The place is deserted. Bloodshot is alone. Hasn’t moved - hasn't blinked -- in hours. His vigil of vengeance. Suddenly Bloodshot’s face begins to twitch, like a contortionist who can no longer hold his pose. Sweat beads on his brow... finally he reaches up, pauses images dancing by. ON SCREEN: one face. Familiar. Australian. This is his guy. The man who shot Gina in front of him. And now we have a name, glowing at us under the profile p
Martin Axe. Found you.
So Long and Harting argue in front of an array of high-te networked computers, unaware that the mugshots of bad guy have finally stopped on Martin Axe.
I just don’t get it. You could pump me full of nanites instead of him. Why bother with Mister Broken Heart at all?
You're right. You don’t get it. It isn’t skill or training that makes him perfect, it’s what drives him.
Technology.

You know the myth of Tantalus? Cursed for the rest of his days to be surrounded by fruit and water that recedes every time he reaches for it? That’s Bloodshot. He’s ever reaching for what he can’t have. (beat) It’s his prison.

I‘1l take his prison over mine any day. More data on Axe starts to fill screens. Files opened. Surveillance photography. It’s the digital version of dum a trash bin full of personal records.  46. The computer system CHIMES with an alert, finally attract Harting’s attention. He looks over at all the search data clearly culled by Bloodshot. SO LONG (CONT’D) Martin Axe? Who's this? ON ONE SCREEN: “Last known location: ST. PETERSBURG.” Bloodshot barrels into the room, surprising the men.
I need to get to Russia.
Bloodshot gets a a fake passport from Tibbs.

Given US tensions with Putin, we can’t risk an incident on Russian soil. That means you're gonna be on your own -- no insertion, no back-up, no exfil. Tibbs notices Bloodshot checking the sights and thumbing safety on a Desert Eagle.
You can’t take that on the plane, you know.

Considering my own blood will probably trip the metal scanner, I'll have to get creative with my travel. The rest of Chainsaw hangs back, saying “goodbye” without saying it. Bloodshot takes a deep breath... is he nervous
Think you’re ready? Few days ago you were a corpse.
Says the woman with the broken neck. KP and Bloodshot share a look... is she worried about him BLOODSHOT (CONT’D) I’1l be fine... survived the freakshow, didn’t I?  47.
We pulled our punches. Last time you saw this Axe clown, guy put a bullet in your brain...
I intend to return the favor.
(taunting) Killing him isn’t gonna bring your wife back.
Being a dick isn’t gonna bring your balls back. So Long’s on his feet -- Bloodshot holds his ground.
Calm down, ladies -- you’re both pretty. Bloodshot notices his pale skin.
I kinda look like I sleep in a coffin.
Don’t like what you see? Change it.
Ha ha. Wait, really?

(samurai wisdom) The body is but an extension of the mind. Bloodshot considers this. He closes his eyes and exhales. MICROSCOPIC SHOT: Bloodshot’s skin cells -- one by one th transform from deathly pale to a robust flesh tone -- PULL OUT: the transformation SPREADS like a wave -- conti PULLING OUT to reveal: Bloodshot... his complexion healthy and vibrant. KP smiles. He's definitely ready. HARTING (PRE-LAP) (CONT’D) You'll brief us every six hours...  48.
Harting leads Bloodshot to the front door. Bloodshot look startlingly normal, like he was when we first saw him.
Nanites use voice over IP so just ask for a connection. There’s a beat of silence... this is it. Bloodshot’s leav
I appreciate you letting me do this. I would’ve felt a pang of guilt if I had to escape instead.
This is a test, for both of us. But as I’ve said, there comes a time when you have to step off the ledge. (then) I’m a dead man if you don’t come back.
Being dead isn’t so bad. (then) I’1l come back.

On a man-made island, giant commercial planes are literal coming in just a hundred feet over hotels and condos to l Out on the tarmac, a herd of PASSENGERS board a 747 while BAGGAGE HANDLERS load the freight compartment. Lingering on the line of Passengers as they ascend the stairs... No sign of Bloodshot here...
You’ve given me a second chance -- a chance to make things right. But then an ASIAN BAGGAGE HANDLER climbs into the freight compartment with a box marked “fragile.”

The Handler sets the box down, walling off a section of t compartment. The Handler then sits behind that wall of baggage, takes off his ear protectors... And stares at his hands. He begins SHAKING HIS HEAD like has water in his ear or something, but then his FACE CHAN  49. MICROSCOPIC SEQUENCE: The brown eyes around his pupils sh to a different color, the skin tone shifts, and then-- It’s BLOODSHOT sitting in the freight compartment. He che himself in the reflective surface of a chrome support bea
Damn. I looked good as an Asian dude.
The 747 vaults into the stratosphere.
Bloodshot has three different suitcases open, pulling out potential clothing options and placing them against his c to see if they’d fit. All the while he’s singing to himse

If you think I’1l sit around while you chip away my brain / Listen I ain’t foolin’ and you'd better think again -- He finds a turtleneck that looks like a good fit and toss it into a Tumi briefcase he’s gutted to claim his own. A bag of homemade COOKIES sits in his lap, pulled from someone's checked luggage. Bloodshot looks up at nothing particular and says: BLOODSHOT (CONT’D) Open new window. Access employee roster for Halcyon Technologies. He takes a bite of a cookie --
Suddenly the MUSIC OF JUDAS PRIEST is blasting in his hea and we're looking at a slew of holographic website data floating in front of us, a dozen windows multitasking.

(music video window) If you think I’1l let it go you’re mad, you've got another thing comin’. One website pulls up a set of EMPLOYEE RECORDS for a tech company while other pages show satellite PHOTOS of a corporate compound in St. Petersburg. It’s an old buildin with rows of very expensive cars out front. The employee records page SCROLLS as if by mental command  50.

The same EMPLOYEE RECORDS show on the screens here at RST They're seeing all of Bloodshot’s inquiries real-time. Also, they’re victim to his music selection. KP sits with Harting in the center, watching the data go like a pair of voyeurs.
Is that Judas Priest?
(sigh) Yes. He’s using our Internet server link as his personal jukebox. KP leans in, increasingly fascinated.
He used Axe’s income return forms to locate a Russian shell company Axe uses as cover. (sees another screen) Now he’s pulling up the building’s history. Is he looking for a point of access?
He can’t just walk in and ask to murder a high-tech arms dealer. So, I'd say yes. On the screens, faces of different RUSSIAN MEN AND WOMEN by, with employee ID numbers.
So what’s he doing with that employee roster?

Probably figuring out how many are working the night shift. THE SCREENS switch to a new video website with the title “Language Learners.” The first video: “Learning Russian. Lesson one.” The video plays at DOUBLE SPEED, all the while Judas Prie still WAILS their guitars, right into --

The 747 now parked at a gate.  51. BAGGAGE HANDLERS dressed for the cold weather unload the luggage from a conveyor belt as the bags travel from the belly of the plane. The Handlers turn around to grab another suitcase but ins find BLOODSHOT riding the conveyor down, dressed more war now himself, too, and carrying his (stolen) briefcase.
(in Russian, subtitled) Luggage inspection. You handled that fragile box like it was your woman, good job. Here, have a cookie. Bloodshot leaves the mystified Handler with the cookie ba

Soaring above the northern capital of Russia, fourth larg city in Europe. Sun glistens off the snow-capped rooftops Street level. ALEXI KRIEGER, parks his car. Groceries in hand, he enters the front door of his up-scale flat.
Viktor! INT. KRIEGER’S FLAT - DAY Silence. Krieger grabs a box of dog treats from his bag. heads into the kitchen and finds --
Viktor. His DOBERMAN. Krieger shakes the box... but the dog could care less... he’s chomping on something else.

(Russian, subtitled) What you got there? Krieger moves closer -- sees that the dog is eating a ste Suddenly -- phone cord goes around Krieger's neck -- Bloodshot pulls it tight -- Krieger struggles --

If I wanted you dead, you’d be dead. Krieger gasps for air --  52. BLOODSHOT (CONT’D) Alexi Krieger. Yeah, I know who you are. You got an attack dog like Viktor for protection because you're not a fighter. So listen t--OOOF! Krieger’s ELBOW jams right in Bloodshot’s gut -- Then Krieger STOMPS Bloodshot’s foot -- Bloodshot loses his grip on the cord for a moment, and so Krieger LUNGES for the knife block -- Bloodshot PULLS back -- too late -- Krieger GRABS a blade LAUNCHES himself backwards -- SLAMS Bloodshot into the fridge -- again -- and again -- Doberman just watches -- that steak is really good. WHAM -- Bloodshot loses his grip on the cord. Krieger spi around -- STABS at Bloodshot -- the blade goes through Bloodshot’s hand -- BLOODSHOT (CONT’D) Seriously?! What’s the dog for?! Krieger sees he has the upper hand now, with Bloodshot impaled next to his fridge.
Disposing of bodies. I will carve you up now.
Here’s your knife back. Bloodshot PUSHES his impaled hand further down the knife.
A stunned Krieger watches as Bloodshot’s black blood heal the wound around the blade -- GRIPPING it so he can pull weapon out of a Krieger's hand.

My god... Bloodshot headbutts the Russian -- BLACKNESS. EXT. KRIEGER’S FLAT - NIGHT Krieger wakes with a start, tied to a chair. Tied with various extension cords. It’s a weird mix of different household items around the chair, including a curling iro  53.
Couldn't find any rope or tape so I had to make do. By the way -- curling iron?
Ex-girlfriend left it. Who are you?
